tool.name: Clustering using RaceID
tool.description: performs clustering, outlier detection, dimensional reduction

param.name: inputrds
param.label: Input RaceID RDS
param.help: Requires the RDS output from the normalisation stage

param.name: knn
param.label: KNN
param.help: Number of nearest neighbours for imputing gene expression

param.name: sat
param.label: Saturation-based clustering?
param.help: Determine number of clusters on saturation point of the mean within-cluster dispersion as a function of the cluster number.

param.name: clustnr
param.label: Max number of clusters using Saturation-by-mean
param.help: Max number of clusters for the derivation of the cluster number by the saturation of mean within-cluster-dispersion.

param.name: samp
param.label: Sample random number of cells
param.help: Number of random sample of cells used for the inference of cluster number and Jaccard similarity

param.name: outminc
param.label: Minimum Transcripts
param.help: minimal transcript count of a gene in a clusters to be tested for being an outlier gene

param.name: outlg
param.label: Minimum Genes
param.help: Minimum number of outlier genes required for being an outlier cell

param.name: final
param.label: Plot Final Clusters?
param.help: Reclassification of cell types using out-of-bag analysis is performed based on the final clusters after outlier identification. If 'FALSE', then the cluster partition prior to outlier identification is used for reclassification.

param.name: probthr
param.label: Outlier Probability Threshold
param.help: Probability threshold for the above specified minimum number of genes to be an outlier cell. This probability is computed from a negative binomial background model of expression in a cluster

param.name: outdistquant
param.label: Outlier Distance Quantile
param.help: Outlier cells are merged to outlier clusters if their distance smaller than the outdistquant-quantile of the distance distribution of pairs of cells in the orginal clusters after outlier removal

param.name: nbtree
param.label: Number of trees to be built

param.name: nbfactor
param.label: Tree Factor
param.help: Number of trees based on the number of cells multiplied by this factor. Effective only if the number of trees parameter is set to 0

param.name: knn
param.label: KNN
param.help: Number of nearest neighbours used for the inference of the Fruchterman-Rheingold layout

param.name: umap_nn
param.label: N Neighbours
param.help: Number of nearest neighbours used for the UMAP connectivity

param.name: initial_cmd
param.label: tSNE map initialised by classical multidimensional scaling

param.name: tablelim
param.label: Table Limit
param.help: Top N genes to print per cluster

param.name: plotlim
param.label: Plot Limit
param.help: Top N genes to plot. Must be less than or equal to the Table Limit

param.name: pvalue
param.label: P-value Cutoff
param.help: P-value cutoff for the inference of differential gene expression

tool.help:
RaceID3 =========
RaceID is a clustering algorithm for the identification of cell types from single-cell RNA-sequencing data. It was specifically designed for the detection of rare cells which correspond to outliers in conventional clustering methods.
This module performs clustering, and outlier detection and ultimately tells you how well defined your clusters are (even if the resultant tSNE plots look messy).
The tool generates the following:
* A list of the most differentially expressed genes in each cluster * Cluster stability plots: * The mean within-cluster dispersion as a function of the cluster number and highlights the saturation point inferred based on the saturation criterion applied by RaceID3. The number of clusters where the change in within-cluster dispersion upon adding further clusters approaches linear behaviour demarcates the saturation point is highlighted in blue. * The point where this flattens out gives you a rough estimate of how many clusters there are in your analysis. * A scatter plot showing the gene expression variance as a function of the mean and the inferred polynomial fit of the background model, as well as a local regression. * This tells you which genes are the most significant against a background model of random expression. * A Jaccard stability plot which tells you how well defined your clusters are prior to outlier identification. * Good stable clusters should near the 0.8 mark, but 0.6 is acceptable, and for a large number of clusters, one or two low scoring clusters are also acceptable. * Heatmaps: * The initial and final clustering (as determined using random forest) * For each of the most differentially expressed genes in each cluster
The tool requires the RData input from the previous filtering / normalisation / confounder removal step to work.
